column17:
Was the participant aware of the goal?
1= YES  0 = NO
column18: Transcribe the written answer of each participant's guess  of the study's goal.
To understand how difficult it can be to complete simple tasks when you are phyically impaired.
To see individuals use techniques with body parts they aren't use to.
To test easier and less expensive forms of performning tasks that impaired people cannot.
The purpose seems to be a replication study about the disposition to find something humerous.  Because the pen forces me to smile I was more likely to find something funny.
The purpose of this experiment was to observe how successful or difficult it was to perform tasks using a different method than typically used.
The purpose of this experiment is to test the ability of a fully functional human being to perform actions that impaired humans have to conduct on a regular basis.
The purpose of this experiment is to analyze the way we perform tasks using parts of the body we usually don't use. In this case, using our mouths to write and its correlation to the way we think.

The purpose of the experiment was to help expand our knowledge and understanding of different ways we can use different body parts for common, daily functions; so that, we can develop different technology to help and advance generations from now the daily use of technologies.
They want to test my ability to perform a task without using what I normally would. This would show how successful I am at adatpting to the task I needed to complete.
To see how effective some less expensive options for physically disabled individuals might be developed.
The purpose of the experiment was to use this test as a preview for developing technology for physically disabled people.
To see how we use parts of our body for tasks we weren't used to using them for.
The purpose of this experiment was to test  ways people who could not move their hands migh be able to write with their mouths. It will be further tested after this experiment.
The purpose of this experiment was to see how people with disabilities function with basic tasks, like writing.
To access whether we can consciously remember instructions for a motor activity while doing tasks that require other motor attention. Basically, attending to two motor instructions at once.
The purpose of this experiment is to see what we can do to help impaired people who cannot use some of the body function like most of us. As I did it I realized how hard it is to use your mouth.
The purpose was to evaluate the effectiveness of using a pen in your mouth to perform various tasks on paper.

To test motor functions and psychomotor coordination. Tested various tasks using body parts not normally used in daily activity, such as our mouth. This experiment tested our ability to use our mouth while performing the tasks we would do with our hands.
I think it is to show how hard it would be if you had no hands or arms to do a task. It might also show that there are simple tasks that we take for granted.
To analayze how people use certain methods to compensate for other disabilities

To see how well we can function using body parts we would not normally use to complete every day tasks, i.e., writing with our teeth. It may be that the cartoons were used to see if we were more apt to be amused if our face was already in a smiling position.
The purpose of this experiment was to see how well we do holding the pen and thinking about the task at hand.
The instructions said it was for investigating the motor skills not normally used but I'm not sure what the cartoons had to do with it.
To test different motor skills, or at least different applications of normal skills.
Ability to use a pen in your mouth to complete a task normally done with your hand
To see if we can do everyday tasks in a way we don't usually
Research ways people with a handicap can do things in a cheaper way
The purpose was to see how people perform various tasks with their body that they would normally not use.
To see how people can make use of alternative parts of their body to perform daily tasks

The purpose of this study was to see how well we can "write" without using the main body parts, limbls, that we usually use. Also, how well we could perform different types of tasks without using our hands. Like drawing a staight line or connecting the dots.
The purpose of this experiment was to test people's ability of performing normal tasks with unusual body parts.

The purpose of the experiment is to see how we perform tasks using different parts of our body that are not typically used for such tasks. Also to see how we can develop tools for people who don't have abilities as others.
To see if people can do things with a different body part

I thought it was to see how I could handle a pen with my teeth but the cartoon rating suggested maybe testing more. Possibly the experiment was also testing how when you do things that make your mouth pull back into a smile like form you generally feel happier and would be more likely to be amused at cartoons.
The purpose of this experiment is to help people with physical disabilities, it made me feel that I am blessed with a healthy body
It was pretty straight forward. The only thing about it was that the pen would often rest against my lips on the side if I tried to make any left or right marks. It was also a little tiring.
To distinguish the challenges of individuals that may have lost their arms and have to use their mouth to write.
I think the purpose of this experiment is to make people aware about the difficulty physically impaired people have to go through.
The purpose of the experiment was to test ability to use different parts of the body to complete different tasks.
To be able to help people be able to do every day tasks, even if they are missing their arms.
The purpose of the experiment was to better understand how people use tools with other body parts than the ones they were intended for so that disabled people can use those tools better.
To get an understanding of different ways someone with a disability could do something like drawing a straight line with their teeth rather than a hand
I think the purpose was to bring awareness to how hard it can be to live with a disability. Even with some of the most basic tasks it can be very challenging and/or humiliating to do.
To test how some people use alternative motor skills for everyday functions
To see if it's natural for all humans or if it's difficult adaptable function to the extent of difficulty
To see how will normal people fiunction using different body parts to do normal tasks that are usually easy
It was to show how a person can adapt to unctional changes  fairly wll
How good I am at performing tasks that I would not normally do. Having to learn how to write only using my mouth reduces focus and sharpness.
To assess how humor can affect one's ability to perfom a task that is out of the ordinary but necessary
To make you thankful that you have limbs
To test the motor skills in an unconventional way to test coordination
To develop understanding of different ways to do everyday tasks
To study the ease of performing tasks with unusual alternative parts of the body, as if impaired from using hands to write
To test simple and cheap ways of compensating for handicapped individuals

This experiment looked to see the effectiveness of using the mouth for every day tasks such as writing.  It seemed that lips were not to be used in order to determine how much control solely using the teeth would have. This experiment may also be looking for ways different people handle the saliva running down the pen in order to present future individuals using their mouths to write with ways to handle the saliva.
To search various cheaper methods of using other parts of body for writing/communicating/operating equipment
To see how someone that hasn't used a different body part to complete a task would do when faced with the task. How hard it would be for someone that hasn't practiced it.
To see how cognitive functioin of the brain goes with holding a pen with your lips
To test how effective our mouth can be to help people with disabilities have better research for advanced technology
To find possible applications/discover ease of use after coming into contact with new devices which may be used to help those with physical disabilities
Some people have disabilities/deformities that make them unable to use normal objects. We are trying to use the pen like they might.
Lines were easier than curves so I gave up on circles real quick and my cheeks are tired like I blew up a balloon
To see people's performance of how well they use parts of their body to do tasks that they aren't used to doing with that body part
To focus on using other senses and seeing if we are able to do the assigned task out of our element
The purpose of this experiment was to see how I could split my attention between doing a task in an unusual manner and holding the pen correctly.
The purpose is to see how effective it is to write holding a pen in one's mouth and still be able to comprehend and perform various tasks
The purpose was to see what it's like to use parts of the body for something other than it's intended purpose
To evaluate motor skills while holding a pen in my mouth to further research for those with physical impairement
To test people's ability to use other body parts when doing thinkgs like writing and drawing
Demonstrate self-control by not using your teeth to hold the pen. I wanted to grip the pen with my teeth for more stability.

According to the earlier paper, the purpose of this experiment is to study psychomotoric skills in order to find ways to help disabled people. However, I do wonder if it had at least something to do with the physical manifestation of emotions as it's difficult to smile with a pen in your mouth and we had to rate how funny cartoons were.
The purpose of this experiment was to observe how easily people adapt to having to do certain tasks in unusual ways, such as holding a pen on one's mouth to write/draw
The purpose is to see how well people can function using parts of their bodies, that they normally would not use, to complete simple tasks

The purpose is to see if those of us who are able to perform tasks easily, such as writing, are able to perform tasks that are not so easy some of which are used by those who cannot write because they have an impairment of some sort
The purpose of the experiment is to see how the mind and body react when charged with a task they aren't naturally meant to
The purose was to see how you can use a different part of your body for a simple task.
The purpose of this experiment was to see how well normal people can perform tasks that people who are impaired have to do always.
The purpose of this experiment is to test alternative forms of writing for those who cannot write conventionally.
To see how well people function using parts of their body for things they are not typicallly used for
To demonstrate how skill can be improved with repetition
To show which tasks are easier to do with a body part that you do not normaly use
I have no clue.
To help develop technology to help people with disabilities
To use body parts I normally wouldn't use and see how I could complete the tasks
The purpose of this experiment was to explore alternative ways we can complete tasks with parts of our body we would not normally use
The purpose of this experiment is to assess whether people can carry out a difficult task (such as using a pen with your mouth) that many handicaps are forced to do because of their condition.
The purpose of this experiment was to be able to figure out new ways that people who are impaired might need
The purpose of the experiment is to test motor abilities through tasks where the person is asked to complete them using unusual methods.
To see how successful a participant could use a part of their body they normally wouldn't use to perform tasks
To test my ability to us psychomotor coordination skills completing easy tasks in a slightly difficult way; testing my ability to use different functions of my brain simultaneously in a weird way.

To help participants understand the difficulties that people without the access to use their hands go through. This experiment also was informative to experimenters of how hard it is for a non-handicapped person to do tasks without their hands.

I think the purpose was to see how well a person could follow directions while also trying to figure out how well we compare to people who have to perform tasks like these everyday because of a disability.
I think the purpose of this test is to test facial feedback.
The purpose of this experiment was to evaluate the ability of someone attempting to perform a task with a different part of the body than normal.

The purpose of the experiment was to see how well we can use psychomotor functioning in areas they are not normally used.  This can help us better understand how psychomotor skills function for people with disabilities.
To study how easily people can use other parts of their bodies. In the long run, to make crippled lives more easy to live.
To try to better understand the taste of performing tasks without the body part that we normally use
I believe the purpose was facial feedback effect.
The purpose is to discover ways people who have impaired use of various body parts (i.e., limbs) could still learn to adapt to function normally.
To determine if using our mouths to write or at least simple tasks can replace our hands if we find ourselves unable to use them
To test the ability of normal people to use methods of writing used by impaired people
To test psychomotor cognition and how well one can use other parts of their bodies for certain tasks
To observe the efficiency of being able to perform everyday tasks (writing) with body parts not associated with them (mouth)
What the feeling is for people who are disabled and cannot use their hands
To test people's ability to perform various tasks using other body parts that aren't usually used for that task
The purpose was to see how we could perform certain tasks with unusual parts of our body. Could be helpful for people with disabilities.
To see if a forced facial expression impacts one's ability to perform physical tasks as well as impact one's feelings towards stimuli
To demonstrate how we take our physical capabilities for granted and to show the process of how our minds connect with our actions.
The purpose of this experiment is to research how people use certain parts of their body to perform tasks that are normally used for such tasks.
The purpose of this experiment was to see the coordination between two different movements like using your mouth to a pen move.

The purpose of this experiment was to see how well people could perform tasks with body parts they don't typically use. The more we understand about people's psychomotor coordination the more it can be applied to people with disabilities.
To elicit understanding of motor difficulties and how these can influence perception
To see how people can perform tasks in a less common manner, with different body parts

The purpose of this experiment was to evaluate my ability to perform a daily normal task with a different part of my body then I would normally use. Furthermore, my attempt to do so will help people who often can't perform common daily tasks.
Using less expensive items instead of more expensive items when have mobility issues
To test how successful motor functions are when used in abnormal ways. Also utilized to determine ways to help make certain tasks easier.
